verses.text: And it came to pass, when David and his men were come to Ziklag on the third day , that the Amalekites had invaded the south , and Ziklag , and smitten Ziklag , and burned it with fire ;
And had taken the women captives , that \add were\add* therein: they slew not any , either great or small , but carried \add them\add* away , and went on their way. \p
¶ So David and his men came to the city , and, behold, \add it was\add* burned with fire ; and their wives , and their sons , and their daughters , were taken captives.
Then David and the people that \add were\add* with him lifted up their voice and wept , until they had no more power to weep.
And David’s two wives were taken captives , Ahinoam the Jezreelitess , and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

And David was greatly distressed ; for the people spake of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved , every man for his sons and for his daughters : but David encouraged himself in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his God.\f + \fr 30.6 \ft grieved: Heb. bitter\f* \p
And David said to Abiathar the priest , Ahimelech’s son , I pray thee, bring me hither the ephod. And Abiathar brought thither the ephod to David.

And David enquired at the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying , Shall I pursue after this troop ? shall I overtake them? And he answered him, Pursue : for thou shalt surely overtake \add them\add*, and without fail recover \add all\add*.
So David went , he and the six hundred men that \add were\add* with him, and came to the brook Besor , where those that were left behind stayed.
But David pursued , he and four hundred men : for two hundred abode behind , which were so faint that they could not go over the brook Besor. \p
¶ And they found an Egyptian in the field , and brought him to David , and gave him bread , and he did eat ; and they made him drink water ;

And they gave him a piece of a cake of figs, and two clusters of raisins : and when he had eaten , his spirit came again to him: for he had eaten no bread , nor drunk \add any\add* water , three days and three nights.

And David said unto him, To whom \add belongest\add* thou? and whence \add art\add* thou? And he said , I \add am\add* a young man of Egypt , servant to an Amalekite ; and my master left me, because three days agone I fell sick.
We made an invasion \add upon\add* the south of the Cherethites , and upon \add the coast\add* which \add belongeth\add* to Judah , and upon the south of Caleb ; and we burned Ziklag with fire.

And David said to him, Canst thou bring me down to this company ? And he said , Swear unto me by God , that thou wilt neither kill me, nor deliver me into the hands of my master , and I will bring thee down to this company. \p

¶ And when he had brought him down , behold, \add they were\add* spread abroad upon all the earth , eating and drinking , and dancing , because of all the great spoil that they had taken out of the land of the Philistines , and out of the land of Judah.

And David smote them from the twilight even unto the evening of the next day : and there escaped not a man of them, save four hundred young men , which rode upon camels , and fled.\f + \fr 30.17 \ft the next…: Heb. their morrow\f*
And David recovered all that the Amalekites had carried away : and David rescued his two wives.
And there was nothing lacking to them, neither small nor great , neither sons nor daughters , neither spoil , nor any \add thing\add* that they had taken to them: David recovered all.
And David took all the flocks and the herds , \add which\add* they drave before those \add other\add* cattle , and said , This \add is\add* David’s spoil. \p

¶ And David came to the two hundred men , which were so faint that they could not follow David , whom they had made also to abide at the brook Besor : and they went forth to meet David , and to meet the people that \add were\add* with him: and when David came near to the people , he saluted them.\f + \fr 30.21 \ft saluted…: or, asked them how they did\f*

Then answered all the wicked men and \add men\add* of Belial , of those that went with David , and said , Because they went not with us, we will not give them \add ought\add* of the spoil that we have recovered , save to every man his wife and his children , that they may lead \add them\add* away , and depart.\f + \fr 30.22 \ft those: Heb. men\f*

Then said David , Ye shall not do so , my brethren , with that which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath given us, who hath preserved us, and delivered the company that came against us into our hand.

For who will hearken unto you in this matter ? but as his part \add is\add* that goeth down to the battle , so \add shall\add* his part \add be\add* that tarrieth by the stuff : they shall part alike.
And it was \add so\add* from that day forward , that he made it a statute and an ordinance for Israel unto this day.\f + \fr 30.25 \ft forward: Heb. and forward\f* \p

¶ And when David came to Ziklag , he sent of the spoil unto the elders of Judah , \add even\add* to his friends , saying , Behold a present for you of the spoil of the enemies of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*;\f + \fr 30.26 \ft present: Heb. blessing\f*
To \add \+w them|strong="H0834"\+w*\add* which \add were\add* in Beth-el , and to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in south Ramoth , and to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Jattir ,
And to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Aroer , and to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Siphmoth , and to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Eshtemoa ,

And to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Rachal , and to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in the cities of the Jerahmeelites , and to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in the cities of the Kenites ,
And to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Hormah , and to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Chor-ashan , and to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Athach ,
And to \add them\add* which \add were\add* in Hebron , and to all the places where David himself and his men were wont to haunt.
